cortex.datasets.neuroimaging package¶

Submodules¶

cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.fmri module¶

Module for fMRI data

class cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.fmri.FMRI(name='fmri', window=10, stride=1, idx=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.fmri.FMRI_IID

fMRI dataset class.

Treats fMRI as sequences, instead as IID as with FMRI_IID.

window¶

int – window size of fMRI batches.

stride¶

int – stride of fMRI batches.

n¶

int – number of subjects.

idx¶

list – indices of subject, scan-window pairs.

next(batch_size=None)[source]¶

Draws the next batch of windowed fMRI.

Parameters:batch_size (Optional[int]) – number of windows in batch.
Returns:dictionary of batched data
Return type:dict
randomize()[source]¶

Randomize the fMRI dataset.

Shuffles the idx.

class cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.fmri.FMRI_IID(name='fmri_iid', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.mri.MRI

fMRI data treated as IID.

Use this dataset if you plan to use a model that needs identical and independently sampled data.

cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.mri module¶

Module for the MRI dataset

class cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.mri.MRI(source=None, name='mri', idx=None, pca_components=0, distribution='gaussian', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.datasets.BasicDataset

Basic MRI dataset iterator.

image_shape¶

tuple – shape of images for visualization.

pca¶

Optional[sklearn.decomposition.PCA] – If not None, PCA decomposition of the data.

pca_components¶

Optional[int] – number of PCA components if self.pca is not None

tmp_path¶

str – path for temporary niftis in visualization.

base_nifti_file¶

str – path for base nifti for forming niftis from arrays.

anat_file¶

str – path for anatomical nifti file for visualization.

sites¶

Optional[list] – list of sites where data was collected.

mask¶

numpy.array – mask

get_data(source)[source]¶

Fetch the MRI dataset.

MRI dataset source is a yaml file. An example format of said yaml is:

name: 'aod',
data: [
    '/Users/devon/Data/AOD/AOD_0.npy',
    '/Users/devon/Data/AOD/AOD_1.npy'
],
mask: '/Users/devon/Data/AOD/AOD_mask.npy',
nifti: '//Users/devon/Data/VBM/H000A.nii',
tmp_path: '/Users/devon/Data/mri_tmp/',
anat_file: '/Users/devon/Data/ch2better_whitebg_aligned2EPI_V4.nii',
sites: '/Users/devon/Data/AOD/AOD_sites.npy'
make_image(X, base_nifti)[source]¶

Create a nitfi image from array.

Parameters:
  • X (numpy.array) – array from which to make nifti image.
  • base_nifti (nipy.core.api.Image) – nifti image template.
Returns:

nipy.core.api.Image
save_images(x, out_file, remove_niftis=True, order=None, stats={}, x_limit=None)[source]¶

Saves images from array.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.array) – array from which to make images.
  • out_file (str) – ouput file for image montage.
  • remove_niftis (bool) – delete images after making montage.
  • order (Optional[list]) – reorder the images in the montage.
  • stats (Optional[dict]) – dictionary of statistics to add to montage.
  • x_limit (Optional(int) – if not None, limit the number of images along the x axis.
save_niftis(X)[source]¶

Save nifti files from array.

Parameters:X (numpy.array) – array from which to make images.
Returns:list of nifti images. list: list of output files for images.
Return type:list

cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.snp module¶

SNP dataset class.

class cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.snp.SNP(source=None, name='snp', mode='train', convert_one_hot=True, idx=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: cortex.datasets.BasicDataset

SNP dataset class.

Currently only handled continuous preprocessed data. Discrete data TODO

get_data(source)[source]¶

Fetch the data from source.

Genetic data is in the matrix format with size Subjec*SNP SNP can be either preprocessed or notprocessed Labels is a vector with diagnosis info Patients are coded with 1 and health control coded with 2

Parameters:source (dict) – file names of genetic data and labels {‘snp’ key for genetic data ‘labels’ key for diagnosis }

Module contents¶

Neuroimaging data classes and utilities

cortex.datasets.neuroimaging.medfilt(x, k)[source]¶

Apply a length-k median filter to a 1D array x.

Boundaries are extended by repeating endpoints.

  • k (int) –
Returns:

numpy.array
